Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( g(z) = e^{iAz} \\), where A is a constant matrix and z a complex variable. We examine the effect of an integral tranformation \\( h(g) = \\int_0^T e^{iBt} g(z) dt \\), with B as another constant matrix, over an interval [0, T].

If at a certain time \\( z_1 \\) within [0, T], a new operator \\( j(g) = e^{Cz}g(z) \\) (where C is a constant matrix) is applied as an intervention, will the function after the interval T reflect only the initial setup (A and B) and not the intervening variable C?
Explanation: The introduction of the operator \\( j(g) \\) partway through the interval modifies the mapping of \\( g(z) \\), adding dependencies on the matrix C as well as A and B. The outcome at T, even under the same initial and boundary conditions, will differ due to this multilayered integration of influence.
